Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Comrie:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application nos. C 100187 ZSK, C 100188 ZSK, special permits, shall be subject to Council review.  These applications are related to application no. C 100185 ZMK and N 100186 ZRK that are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Special Permits (C100187ZSK, C100188ZSK)

Items.Title:
By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 900 7th Avenue, Community Board 5, Application 20105393 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 900 Seventh Ave, Brooklyn (20105393TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving an exemption from real property taxes for property located at (Block 3002, Lots 13, 16, 20) and (Block 2938, Lot 49) the Bronx, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (L.U. 114).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 114 - Bryant Mews,  Bronx and Mid-Bronx Plaza, Bronx

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one percent (1.0%) per annum for Fiscal Year 2011.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one percent (1.0%) per annum for FY'11.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for Fiscal Year 2011 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000), or not more than two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000) per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 9% per annum for FY'11 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for Fiscal Year 2011 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 18% per annum for FY'11 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2011 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $250,000, or not more $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate to be charged for FY'11 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 9% per annum for real property where the assessed value is not more than $250,000, or not more $250,000 per residential unit.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2011 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate to be charged for FY'11 for non-payment of water rents and sewer rents be 18% per annum for real property where the assessed value is over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York City Banking Commission - Transmitting recommendations of the interest rate to be charged for Fiscal Year 2011 for non-payment of taxes on real estate, and for non-payment of water and sewer rents and transmitting recommendation of the discount rate to be allowed for early payment of real estate taxes for Fiscal Year 2011, pursuant to the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Transmitting recommendations of the interest rate to be charged for FY'11 for non-payment of taxes on real estate, and for non-payment of water and sewer rents.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass language in the 2011 Defense Authorization Act that would repeal “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell, Don’t Harass, Don’t Pursue” and to allow lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered persons to serve openly in the military.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.  

The following Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Member Greenfield.

The following Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council embers Halloran, Ignizio, Koo, Mealy, Sanders, Vallone, Jr., and Oddo.


Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass language in the 2011 Defense Authorization Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to amend the Community Reinvestment Act to provide credits to financial institutions that fund affordable middle-income housing construction projects that have stalled or suspended their activities due to a discontinuance of project funding.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Community Development
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following  4 Council Members formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Members Halloran, Ignizio, Vallone, Jr. and Oddo.


Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress to amend the Community Reinvestment Act.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of pending legislation in the New York State Legislature, which would amend the Penal Law by creating the crimes of criminal obstruction of breathing or blood circulation and strangulation in the first and second degrees.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Creating the crimes of criminal obstruction of breathing or blood circulation and strangulation in the first and second degrees.
